afghan.text: Forget the past , but look out in the future.
A lame crab walks straight.
A leopard's spots: or, what is bred in the babe will come out in the flesh.
A liar is forgetful.
A lion at home, and a fox abroad.
A little water is a sea to an ant.
A mother and daughter fought, and fool thought they meant it.
A mother won't give milk to her child until he cries.
A mountain doesn't reach out to mountain, a man is reaching out to a man.
A new servant can catch a running deer.
A palm tree growing in the shade will not bear ripe fruit.
A bad wound heals, but a bad word doesn't.
A bird only flies as high as his wings take him.
A broken hand can work but a broken heart can't.
A cheap thing doesn't lack defect, nor an expensive thing quality.
A donkey has two friends: his two hind legs.
A drunken donkey will not remember the monkeys bite.
A fish with teeth tastes the same as fish without.
A fox is in trouble because of his own pelt.
A frog hopped onto a wall and cried, 'I can see Kashmir!'
A good year is determined by its spring.
Blood is thick than water.
Blood will have blood.
Blood will tell.
Bloom where you are planted.
Cats don't catch mice to please God.
Community is not made by force.
Debt severs love.
Don't be a thief and won't fear the king.
Don't be a thief and you won't fear the king.
Don't show me the palm tree, show me the dates.
Don't show me the palm-tree, show me the dates.
Don't sprinkle salt on my wound.
Don't stop a donkey that isn't yours.
Don't use your teeth when you can untie the knot with your fingers.
Donated vinegar is sweeter than honey.
Even if a knife is made of gold, a person won't stab his own heart with it.
Even if a knife is made of silver, a person won't stab his own heart with it.
Even the Judge was drunk when the wine was free.
Even the largest army is nothing without a good general.
Every anguish passes except the anguish of hunger.
A tree doesn't move unless there is wind.
A wanton eye is the messenger of a lusting heart.
A warm fire is better than any delicious food.
A warm fire is better than delicious cooked rice.
A wise enemy is better than a foolish friend.
A wolf's pup will grow into a wolf even though it be raised among men.
A wound will heal. Talk won't.
After every darkness is light.
Allah has said, "Start moving so that I may start blessing."
An intelligent enemy rather than a foolish friend.
A porcupine speaking to its baby says, "O my child of velvet."
A real friend is one who takes the hand of his friend in times of distress and helplessness.
A real friend takes the hand of his friend in overwhelming worry and fire.
A river is made drop by drop.
A river is not cntaminated by having a dog drink from it.
A river is not contaminated by having a dog drink from it.
A sandal is not a shoe; a cap is not a turban.
A stick for the nobody, a hint for the nobleman.
A tilted load won't reach its destination.
A tree does not move unless there is wind.
He reckons his importance by the elephant-load.
He saved his ears, but lost his head.
He who goes to the blacksmith's shop comes home with scorched clothes.
Hearing is never as good as seeing.
Heaven is dark and yet out of it streams clear water.
Heed the troubadour, burn the dinner.
However tall the mountain is, there's a road to the top of it.
I have never seen anyone go astray who followed along the right way.
I'm talking to the door, but I want the walls to hear me.
If a forest catches fire, both the dry and the wet will burn up.
An old friend is like a saddled horse.
As long as the beard exists, the world clenches its fists. As long as the pakul hat exists, the world stutters in fits.
As long as there are fools in the world, no one will be penniless.
As long as there is no wind, the tree won't blow.
As the sun's shadow shifts, so there is no permanence on earth.
Ask the truth from a child.
Be patient with your enemies and forgiving of your friends.
Being clean is the half of faith.
between brother and brother, accounts should be square.
Blood cannot be washed out with blood.
What's a trumpeter's job? To blow.
Whatever you sow, you reap.
When an ant says 'ocean', he's talking about a puddle.
When God gives, He doesn't ask whose son a person is.
When the hen gets fat, she stops lying.
When the tiger kills, the jackal profits.
When the wine is free even the judge drinks it.
When water goes over your head, what difference if it's one fathom or a hundred fathoms.
When you enjoy loving your neighbor, it ceases to be a virtue.
Where the heart would go, there follows the foot.
Your aspirations are in heaven, but your brains are in your feet.
Every dog is a lion at home.
Every man thinks his own thoughts are best.
Every rock strikes the feet of the poor.
Every tree feels the force of the wind.
Everyone thinks his own thoughts are best.
Fear the person who doesn't fear God.
Fear the worse.
Fire, fire's better than rice.
First food, then religion.
Five fingers are brothers but are not equals.
In the shop of the sightless jeweler, the ruby and pebble are one.
Instead of better, it got worse.
It is easier to wage war with wise enemies than be at peace with foolish friends.
It may smell like a melon, but is it going to make you sick?
It's the same donkey, but with a new saddle.
Learning makes some into Mullahs and some into devils.
Let Christians practice their own religion, and Jews practice theirs.
Look after your property, and you won't accuse your neighbour of being a thief.
Man sins... then blames it on the devil.
May God not make one hand dependent on the other.
One flower doesn't bring spring.
One gives by tons, but takes accounts by ounces.
One who doesn't appreciate the apple, won't appreciate the orchard.
One who runs will also fall.
Only bread and an onion? Your life's still an open one.
Only stretch you foot to the length of your blanket.
Only stretch your foot to the length of your blanket.
Patience is bitter, but it has a sweet fruit.
Poor iron won't make a sharp sword.
Reading Scripture in front of a donkey.
Salt preserves meat, but what can be done with salt if it is bad.
Same donkey, different saddle.
Saying salaam is a sign of true faith.
Smart people get the point from a single hint.
Some men wonder over God's values, others over the cut of a garment.
Storing milk in a sieve, you complain of bad luck?
That which is obvious does not need to be explained.
The best weapon is the one that's to hand.
The butcher should not be trusted that has missing neighbors.
The cheap thing isn't without problem, the expensive without help.
The wood is burnt, but the ashes are a nuisance.
The world is the traveler's inn.
The world lives on hope.
The world will not find rest by just saying "peace."
The yellow dog is brother to the wolf.
There are no greater prudes than those women who have their own dirty secrets to hide.
There are twenty-five uncaught sparrows for a penny.
There is a doorway that connects two hearts.
There is a path to the top of even the highest mountain.
There is a path to the top of highest mountain.
Five of them would run from the bang of one empty gun.
Flourish like a flower, but may your life be longer.
Forget the past, but look out in the future.
Give even an onion graciously.
Give every man his due.
Give graciously -- even an onion.
Glory is fitting to God alone.
Go out from your village: don't let your village go out form you.
God has said, "Start moving so that I may start blessing."
God isn't in need of our prayers.
The potter drinks water from a broken jug.
The right answer to a fool is silence.
The river won't get dirty just by the dog's bark.
The rose is a friend of the thorn.
The seeker is the finder.
The skin fits closer than the shirt.
The sun cannot be hidden by two fingers.
The tree will not sway without a trace of wind.
The ungrateful son is a wart on his father's face; to leave it is a blemish, to cut it off is pain.
The ungrateful son is like a wart on his father's face; to leave it there is unsightly, to cut it off is painful.
The crow is clever, but looks at what it eats.
The deaf laugh twice.
The first day you meet, you are friends; the next day you meet, you are brothers.
The first day you see a friend; the next day, a brother.
The flower has no front or back.
The land of marriage has this peculiarity: That strangers are desirous of inhabiting it, while its natural inhabitants would gladly be exiled.
The man dying to hang himself can always find a noose.
The mud of one country is the medicine of another.
The night may be dark, but the apples have been counted.
The person who is cornered will fight.
There is a way from heart to heart.

Though God is almighty, he doesn't send rain from a clear sky.
To speak ill of anyone is to speak ill of yourself.
Too many butchers spoil the cow.
Try out your shoes on your feet -- gauge people against their misfortune.
Two are better than one, and three than two.
Two watermelons can't be grabbed in one hand.
Two watermelons can't be held in one hand.
Under his bowl there is a little bowl.
God said, "Eat and drink," but He didn't say, "Gorge to the full."

Grumbling and carping are the muscles of the weak.
Hasty work doesn't succeed.
Having been bitten by a snake, he's afraid of a rope.
He appreciates prosperity who is caught in calamity.
He has soaked a hundred heads, but hasn't shaved one.
He hasn't time even to scratch his head.
He is riding the donkey, but has lost the donkey.
He ran out from under a leaking roof and sat in the rain.

If there is only bread and onions, still have a happy face.
If you deal in camels, make the doors high.
If you don't recognize God, at least know Him by His power.
If you sit with us, you will get like us; if you sit beside a cooking pot, you will get black.
If you want to keep camels, have a big enough door.
In an ant colony, the dew is a flood.
In bad things be slow; in good things be quick.
In childhood you are palyful, In youth you are lustful In old age you are feeble, So when will you before God be worshipful?
In the ditch where water has flowed, it will flow again.
May Kabul be without gold rather without snow.
My drum doesn't do what I want it to.
No deceit, no merchant.
No one says his own buttermilk is sour.
No rose is without thorns.

On earth it's hard and heaven is far away.

Vinegar that is free, is sweeter than honey.
Walls have mice and mice have ears.
Walls have mice, mice [have] ears.

What you sow, shall you reap.
What you spend, you have.
